Title: Series: Cabinet du Roy
Description: Rest on the flight into Egypt; mountainous landscape with a river running into the left foreground, and in the right foreground the Holy Family resting on the bank; some buildings in the distance; after Annibale Carracci, or an artist from his studio Etching
Producer name: Print made by: Anne Claude Philippe de Tubières, Comte de Caylus
Curator's comments: From 'Cabinet du Roy', see 1965,0319.2.1 for comment on the set and on the album. The original drawing is in the Département des Arts Graphiques, Louvre (Inv. 7482). It is catalogued among the works of Annibale Carracci; Catherine Loisel proposes to attribute the drawing to the studio of Annibale Carracci ("Inventaire général des dessins italiens, VII : Ludovico, Agostino, Annibale Carracci', Paris, 2004, No.777, p.310) Stephen M. Bailey attributes the Louvre drawing to a 'Master of the Blocky Plateau' ("Carracci landscape studies: the drawings related to the 'Recueil de 283 Estampes de Jabach'", 1993, No.70, p.314-317).
Bibliographic references: IFF / Inventaire du Fonds Français: Bibliothèque Nationale, Département des Estampes (162)
